general_advisory: In view of five days weather forecast received from IMD, farmers can resume agronomic practices and application of fertilizer. Farmers are advised to apply pesticides with a sticker by keeping in view of real-time weather conditions. Apply balanced and appropriate fertilizers according to the crop’s growth stage. Avoid excess nitrogen as it promotes excessive vegetative growth and increases water demand.

advisory: Farmers are advised to spray of leaf extracts of Bael, Tulsi, or Neem per litre of water for reducing the incidence of insects & diseases.

Current weather is favorable for blast infestation. If leaf blast is observed in rice field, spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG (Nativo) @ 80 g/acre or Isoprothiolane 40 EC (Sultan/Fujita/Fujione) @ 300 ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water. Repeat the spray at 7-10 days interval.

There is a chance of infestation of sheath rot and sheath blight in paddy in prevailing weather conditions. To manage this disease spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG (Nativo) @ 80 gram/acre or Propiconazole 25% EC (Tilt/Zerox/Dhan/Bumper) @ 200ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water.
Application of plant hormone Planofix @ 7 ml mixing with 15 liters of water is advisable at 60-65 DAS for improving the seed cotton yield.
As the crop is at 60-70 days stage, apply total killer herbicide glyphosate or Glufosinate Ammonium 13.5% @ 50ml/10 litre water as directed spray using hoods to control all types of weeds.
Apply 20 kg urea/acre in hybrids and 15 kg urea/acre in high yielding varieties as second top dressing at 60 DAS.
To control leaf webber infestation spray Profenophos 50% EC or Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5% EC @ 2 ml/lit @ 2ml/lit of water.

Monitor your field regularly for signs of pest infestation. Sucking pest infestation may be seen in prevailing weather conditions. To prevent sucking pests like aphids, jassids, and thrips, neem-based pesticide (1500 ppm) may be sprayed @ 3ml/lit of water at the initial stage of infestation.
Wilting may be observed after receding of rain. Apply Metiram 75% WG @ 1.5g/liter at the root zone of the plant as a control measure.
Apply Urea @ 25kg/ac if the crop is at tasseling stage and irrigate if water is not sufficient.
Stem borer, FAW, and banded leaf and sheath blight may appear due to present weather conditions. Monitor the field regularly and remove infected plant parts.
For effective control of stem borer spray Fipronil 5% SC or Profenophos 50% EC @ 400ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water.
Install yellow sticky trap @ 8nos./acre to monitor sucking pests.
Wilting: Spray Tebuconazole 25.9% EC @ 200-ml/acre + Streptocycline @ 30g/acre at the root zone by mixing with 200 liters of water.
Install Blue sticky trap @ 8nos./acre to monitor thrips infestation.

Prevailing weather condition is favorable for thrips attack. Plants are affected by thrips if leaves curl upward. If symptoms are seen spray neem-based pesticide Azadiractin (1500 ppm) @ 3ml/liter of water at the initial stage of infestation.
Now, it is a suitable time for raising tomato seedlings.
Suitable Varieties: Utkal Kumari (BT-10), Utkal Deepti (BT-2), Utkal Raja, Utkal Pragyan, and Swarna Sampad.
Seed rate: 150 to 200 gram/acre
As grasses are high in moisture content during rainy days, the cattle don’t get adequate dry matter from those. So, give 1 kg if concentrate for every 2 kg of milk to dairy animals.

Keep dry fodder and straw ready at home for sheep and goat in the rainy season and ensure the practice of flushing to give balanced concentrate to sheep and goat one month prior to kidding and lambing.
Bird flu is a viral disease of poultry. It spreads through contaminated feathers, saliva, droppings of birds. Sometimes it can spread from affected birds to human beings.
During this time please clean poultry houses every day and change the feed and water of poultry birds frequently.
Don’t throw the dead poultry birds here and there. Please bury them by wearing gloves and masks and sanitize the place with bleaching powder.
Don’t bring poultry birds or eggs to home from the affected area.
